companions_questline.name: The Companions
companions_questline.description: Join the ancient warrior guild of Jorrvaskr, earn your place in the Inner Circle, and face the choice of lycanthropy or purity as Kodlak Whitemane's fate hangs in the balance.

companions_investigate_jorrvaskr.name: Investigate Jorrvaskr
companions_investigate_jorrvaskr.description: You arrive at Jorrvaskr to learn how the Companions live, train, and judge potential recruits before asking to join.
objectives: Take in the hall and observe the Companions in their home
Descend into Jorrvaskr’s downstairs living area (Grand Hall) for the first time
Optional: Accept Athis’ sparring challenge (first to impose a Mild consequence wins)
Optional: Speak with Vignar Gray-Mane if you overhear his war conversation
Speak with Kodlak Whitemane about joining the Companions
companions_investigate_jorrvaskr.notes: Pre-Proving Honor setup quest used to stage first impressions and early social hooks in Jorrvaskr.

companions_proving_honor.name: Proving Honor
companions_proving_honor.description: To earn a place among the Companions of Jorrvaskr, you must prove your honor and battle-worth. Kodlak Whitemane sets you a trial: recover a fragment of Wuuthrad from a bandit-held dungeon and return it to Jorrvaskr. The quest is a test of courage, discipline, and Nordic virtue.
objectives: Complete Companions contracts to prove reliability (fills Honor Proving — Contracts Done 0/2)
Report to Kodlak when summoned to the Harbinger’s Room (Skjor present)
Travel to Dustman’s Cairn with your assigned shield-brother/sister
Recover the Wuuthrad fragment from the depths
Return the fragment to Kodlak and formally join the Companions
rewards: Official membership in the Companions (rank: Companion)
Access to Jorrvaskr's training yard and armory
Kodlak's personal respect (+2 trust with Kodlak Whitemane)
+2 Companions faction standing

outcomes.fragment_recovered: The fragment is returned. Kodlak clasps your arm and speaks the old words of welcome. You are a Companion.
outcomes.valor_displayed: Fighting through with discipline and grit earns a free invoke on 'Proven in Battle' for the next dungeon scene.
outcomes.quick_retreat: You recovered the fragment but left some enemies standing. Vilkas will note it - take -1 trust with Vilkas.

companions_proving_honor.notes: Entry quest for the Companions arc. Mirrors the College's 'First Lessons' in function. Vilkas and Farkas are present in Jorrvaskr; their dispositions toward the PC are set here. If PC demonstrates exceptional combat ability (SWS on Fight), Farkas offers a free sparring stunt for later. Phase 2 hooks: first-time Harbinger Room entry triggers Kodlak/Vilkas foreshadow scene; first-time Yard entry can trigger Vilkas Trial by Combat (first Mild consequence wins). After Vilkas trial, escort-to-whelps logic branches based on active side-quests (Aela vs Farkas vs Vilkas). Phase 3: When Honor Proving — Contracts Done hits 2/2, fire the Harbinger Room briefing. Briefing selects mission companion (Aela/Vilkas/Farkas) based on side quest completion. Dustman’s Cairn uses companion-reactive dungeon triggers and introduces a named Silver Hand antagonist with a recruitment seed for Purity-track PCs.

companions_inner_circle_rites.name: Inner Circle Rites
companions_inner_circle_rites.description: After proving yourself among the rank and file, Skjor pulls you aside and offers initiation into the Companions' Inner Circle - the secret society of werewolves known as the Circle. You must choose: embrace the lycanthropic gift that grants power beyond mortal reckoning, or refuse it in honor of Kodlak's own wish to be cured. This choice will shape the entire arc.
objectives: Speak privately with Skjor in the Underforge beneath Jorrvaskr
Learn the truth of the Circle's werewolf nature
Decide: embrace lycanthropy or refuse the gift
Complete the initiation rite (or resist it)
rewards: Inner Circle membership and access to the Underforge

If embraced: Werewolf Form stunt (once per session, transform for one scene - Fight+2 and Physique+2, move 2 zones, Weapon:2 claws, gorge to heal; cannot use social skills or Thu'um while transformed; requires Will vs Fair (+2) at scene end or take 'Shame of the Wolf' mild mental consequence; see data/stunts/companions.json)
If refused: Unlock Oath of Ysgramor (see data/stunts/companions.json) and gain 'Kodlak's Blessing' aspect with 1 free invoke (Kodlak confides deeper secrets)

embrace_curse.description: PC accepts the blood and becomes a werewolf. Sets state flag embraced_curse=true. Skjor becomes a strong ally.

refuse_curse.description: PC refuses lycanthropy. Sets embraced_curse=false. Kodlak is deeply moved and shares his own desire to cure himself.

companions_inner_circle_rites.notes: This is the pivotal choice of the arc. The embraced_curse flag governs Kodlak's fate branch and Skjor's role later. If Skjor is alive when companions_kodlak_cure_or_sacrifice is reached and embraced_curse is true, the Dragonbreak branch triggers.

companions_kodlak_cure_or_sacrifice.name: Cure or Sacrifice
companions_kodlak_cure_or_sacrifice.description: Kodlak Whitemane lies dying - an enemy ambush on the Companions has struck him down. With his final breaths he asks you to choose his legacy: attempt the ritual that might purge the lycanthropic taint from his soul and free him to walk Sovngarde, or allow his death to stand and honor the beast blood he carried. This is the moral heart of the questline.
objectives: Reach the dying Kodlak after the ambush at Whiterun
Gather the components for the Glenmoril Witch cure (or choose not to)
Perform the cure rite at the Flame of the Harbinger, or stand aside
Witness Kodlak's fate and take up the mantle of leadership
rewards: If cured: 'Kodlak's Soul Freed' campaign aspect (1 free invoke), unlocks Sovngarde power
If not cured: 'Weight of What Was Not Done' aspect on PC (compellable), Companions respect Kodlak's beast-burial

cure_kodlak.description: PC gathers witch heads and purges Kodlak's wolf spirit. Kodlak dies at peace. Dragonbreak branch skipped (proceeds to final_journey).

skjor_alive_and_curse_embraced.description: If Skjor is alive AND embraced_curse=true, a Dragonbreak event fires before the cure choice is finalized, forking into companions_skjor_dragonbreak.

sacrifice_kodlak.description: PC chooses not to cure Kodlak. He dies under the beast blood. The Companions honor him as a warrior, not a freed soul.

companions_kodlak_cure_or_sacrifice.notes: Dragonbreak trigger: check state['companions_state']['skjor_alive'] AND state['companions_state']['embraced_curse']. If both true, inject companions_skjor_dragonbreak before final_journey. The GM should present the cure option as costly (requiring travel to Glenmoril Coven) to give the choice real weight.

companions_skjor_dragonbreak.name: The Dragonbreak of Jorrvaskr
companions_skjor_dragonbreak.description: This branch only activates if Skjor survived the earlier ambush AND the PC embraced lycanthropy. Skjor, grief-stricken and beast-blooded, performs a desperate ritual to reverse time's flow around Kodlak's death - a minor Dragonbreak anchored to Jorrvaskr. Two timelines momentarily coexist: one where Kodlak is saved, one where he dies. The PC must navigate the fracture and choose which thread to pull closed.
objectives: Reach the Underforge as Skjor begins the Dragonbreak ritual
Navigate the fractured timeline (two versions of Jorrvaskr exist simultaneously)
Decide which timeline to stabilize: save Kodlak or let the beast-blood stand
Seal the Dragonbreak before it propagates beyond Jorrvaskr
rewards: Dragonbreak resolved: +2 fate points from the temporal stress
Skjor's loyalty locked as a permanent ally
Unique aspect 'Witnessed the Fracture' (1 free invoke on timeline-related Lore checks)

dragonbreak_mechanics.trigger_condition: skjor_alive == true AND embraced_curse == true AND active_quest == companions_kodlak_cure_or_sacrifice
dragonbreak_mechanics.resolution: PC makes a Will roll vs Great (+4) to close the fracture; success with style preserves both timeline aspects as boosts

companions_skjor_dragonbreak.notes: This is the special Skjor-alive branch described in the problem statement. The DragonbreakManager should be used if available. This quest is skipped if Skjor died or if the PC refused lycanthropy. After this quest, the arc always proceeds to companions_final_journey.

companions_purity_path_ignites.name: Purity Path Ignites
companions_purity_path_ignites.deprecation_note: Replaced by Phase 4+ schism arc starting at companions_circle_revelation. This quest node is retained for save-state compatibility only.
companions_purity_path_ignites.description: DEPRECATED — see companions_circle_revelation. The cure rites at Ysgramor's Tomb are complete. Kodlak, Vilkas, and Farkas have had the beast blood burned from their souls by the Harbinger Flame. Wuuthrad has been reforged and placed in Elitrof's hands. Now the Inner Circle is fractured: three members are cured, two (Aela and Skjor) are not — and the Silver Hand will escalate in response to the tomb's events. Elitrof must return to Jorrvaskr, secure the hall, manage the ideological fallout within the Circle, and prepare for the Silver Hand's next move.
objectives: Leave Ysgramor's Tomb and travel back to Whiterun with the cured Circle members
Secure Jorrvaskr against Silver Hand retaliation
Navigate the ideological divide between cured members (Kodlak, Vilkas, Farkas) and the remaining werewolves (Aela, Skjor)
Respond to Silver Hand escalation triggered by the Nightgate ambush and the cure rites
Determine next steps for the Companions' future under the Purity Path
rewards: Harbinger candidacy signaled (Kodlak's private acknowledgment)
Wuuthrad (Reforged) permanently carried by Elitrof
Inner Circle trust advanced for Kodlak, Vilkas, Farkas
Clarity on Aela and Skjor's stance — potential future complications

secure_jorrvaskr_diplomatically.description: Elitrof manages the Circle divide with measured persuasion. Aela and Skjor remain uneasy but stable allies.

secure_jorrvaskr_with_authority.description: Elitrof asserts authority as Harbinger-in-waiting. Aela bristles; Skjor backs down. Trust with Aela -5.

silver_hand_retaliation_preempt.description: If Silver Hand Vendetta clock reaches 5 before the hall is secured, an ambush on Jorrvaskr triggers mid-scene.

companions_purity_path_ignites.notes: DEPRECATED. Replaced by companions_circle_revelation + Phase 4 schism chain. Retained for save-state compatibility.

companions_circle_revelation.name: Circle Revelation
companions_circle_revelation.description: After returning from Proving Honor, Skjor pulls you into the Underforge beneath Jorrvaskr and reveals the truth of the Circle's lycanthropic nature. You must choose: embrace Beast Blood and run with the pack, or refuse in the name of Kodlak's purity. This choice ignites a Tradition vs New Way schism that will reshape the Companions forever.
objectives: Follow Skjor to the Underforge beneath Jorrvaskr
Witness the truth of the Circle's beast blood
Decide: embrace lycanthropy (Beast Blood path) or refuse (Purity path)
Report your decision to Kodlak — and watch the schism begin
rewards: Inner Circle access (Underforge key)
Beast Blood path: sets beast_blood_embraced=true; Skjor becomes strong ally
Purity path: sets beast_blood_embraced=false; Kodlak confides deeper secrets, unlocks Oath of Ysgramor stunt

embrace_beast_blood.description: PC accepts the blood and transforms. Sets beast_blood_embraced=true. Skjor and Aela gain trust. Kodlak is saddened but accepts.

refuse_beast_blood.description: PC refuses lycanthropy. Sets beast_blood_embraced=false. Kodlak is moved. Skjor is wary. Circle divide widens.

companions_circle_revelation.notes: Anchor quest for Phase 4. Mirrors canon's 'The Silver Hand' initiation without forcing acceptance. Fires companions_schism_tradition_vs_newway clock initialization. Both branches converge into companions_schism_pressure. The Underforge symbolism (sun vs moon, Skyforge above / Underforge below) should be played up.

companions_pack_run_night.name: Pack Run: Night
companions_pack_run_night.description: Skjor and Aela take you on a night run in beast form outside Whiterun. The power is intoxicating, the moral edge sharp. You return changed — and the Circle's inner faction now sees you as one of them.
objectives: Transform in the Underforge with Skjor and Aela present
Run with the pack through the tundra (one scene of beast-form freedom)
Return before dawn and report to Kodlak — omission or honesty are both choices
rewards: Werewolf Form stunt (see data/stunts/companions.json)
Skjor trust +15, Aela trust +10
Scene aspect 'Taste of the Pack' with 1 free invoke
Schism clock ticks +1 (secrecy enforced)

outcomes.honest_with_kodlak: Kodlak receives the news with grief and resolve. Schism clock ticks +1. He does not punish you.
outcomes.lie_to_kodlak: The deception holds — for now. If exposed later, Kodlak's trust takes -10. Sets flag circle_lied_to_kodlak=true.
outcomes.partial_truth: Kodlak reads between the lines. He says nothing yet. Tension held in reserve.

companions_pack_run_night.notes: Beast Blood path branch from companions_circle_revelation. Runs before companions_schism_pressure.

companions_oath_of_purity.name: Oath of Purity
companions_oath_of_purity.description: You refused the beast blood. Kodlak takes you aside and in quiet, unguarded words, shares his own desire to be cured. He asks you to be a living symbol of what the Companions could become. The Circle's Tradition faction does not take this well.
objectives: Speak privately with Kodlak in his chamber after refusing the Circle
Swear the Oath of Purity (or choose to remain uncommitted)
Face Skjor's challenge in the hall (social — not combat)
Navigate the first wave of social backlash from Tradition members
rewards: Oath of Ysgramor stunt (see data/stunts/companions.json)
Kodlak trust +15
Aspect 'Harbinger's Chosen' with 1 free invoke
Schism clock ticks +1 (public humiliation of Tradition faction)

outcomes.take_oath: Kodlak speaks the old words of binding. You are now officially the Purity faction's symbol.
outcomes.decline_oath_stay_neutral: Kodlak nods. 'Your silence is its own answer.' You hold the middle — both factions are wary.
outcomes.skjor_confrontation_escalates: If Skjor's hostility roll succeeds against your Will, schism clock ticks an extra +1.

companions_oath_of_purity.notes: Purity path branch from companions_circle_revelation. Runs before companions_schism_pressure. The social backlash scene uses Provoke/Will mechanics.

companions_schism_pressure.name: Schism Pressure
companions_schism_pressure.description: The Tradition vs New Way split has begun to fracture Jorrvaskr. Secrecy arguments erupt between Circle members, whelps are quietly recruited to one side, and the elders issue ultimata. The companions_schism_tradition_vs_newway clock ticks toward a breakpoint. You must navigate faction scenes, resolve or escalate disputes, and watch the companions_whelps_polarization clock fill.
objectives: Witness three schism scenes (secrecy argument / whelp recruitment / elder ultimatum)
Decide your stance in each scene: mediate, side with Tradition, or side with New Way
Monitor the schism clock — if it reaches 6/6, breakpoint triggers automatically
Optionally gather Silver Hand intelligence to redirect internal pressure outward
rewards: Schism clock position determines available breakpoint options
Vilkas trust shifts based on stance consistency
If whelps_polarization reaches 4/4: 'mini civil war' flag set — breakpoint options narrow

clock_triggers.companions_schism_tradition_vs_newway: Advances on: secrecy enforced (+1), violence between members (+1), public humiliation of one faction (+1), whelp recruitment (+1), elder ultimata (+1).
clock_triggers.companions_whelps_polarization: Advances on: each whelp forced to pick a side (+1 per whelp).

companions_schism_pressure.notes: Hub quest for Phase 4 middle arc. Each schism scene is a discrete event call in scripts/companions_schism_events.py. The GM should run 2-3 sessions here before advancing to breakpoint.

companions_schism_breakpoint.name: Schism Breakpoint
companions_schism_breakpoint.description: The schism can no longer be contained. Kodlak calls a hall-moot and demands resolution. You must choose a path: reconcile the factions, spearhead reform as New Way champion, enforce Tradition's iron code, or let the factional war ignite.
objectives: Attend the hall-moot called by Kodlak
Choose your path: Reconcile / Spearhead Reform / Enforce Tradition / Faction Civil War
Execute the chosen path's immediate consequences
Transition into the Silver Hand pressure track and assault preparation

reconcile.description: PC brokers a shared code and partial transparency. Both factions stand down. Schism clock reset to 3. Silver hand assault prep ticks slower.

spearhead_reform.description: PC leads public accountability push, opens cure access, proposes new oaths. New Way wins. Tradition members Skjor/Aela are alienated (-15 trust).

enforce_tradition.description: PC backs Tradition's secrecy and strength. New Way members Kodlak/Vilkas are disappointed (-10 trust each). Skjor/Aela loyal (+15 trust each).

faction_civil_war.description: PC refuses to choose or the clock hit 6/6 without mediation. Whelps choose sides, duels break out, expulsions begin. Sets internal_civil_war=true. Assault prep clock ticks +2 immediately.

companions_schism_breakpoint.notes: All four branches feed into the Silver Hand pressure track (companions_silver_hand_intel). The internal_civil_war flag affects Jorrvaskr defense pool at assault time.

companions_silver_hand_intel.name: Silver Hand: Intel
companions_silver_hand_intel.description: The Silver Hand is mobilizing. Aela has received word of cells in the holds, supply caches, and sympathizers inside Whiterun's walls. You must identify their network before they strike Jorrvaskr. Each cell left alive ticks the silver_hand_assault_preparation clock.
objectives: Interrogate or investigate to locate at least two Silver Hand cells
Identify the supply cache(s) feeding the assault preparation
Expose or eliminate sympathizers inside Whiterun (optional, reduces clock by 1)
Report findings to Aela and prepare for the Gallows Rock strike
rewards: silver_hand_assault_preparation clock reduced by 1 per cell dismantled
Aela trust +10
Access to Silver Hand loot cache (silver weapons, bounty letters)

clock_triggers.silver_hand_assault_preparation: Ticks +1 for each cell left alive after this quest; +1 for public werewolf incidents; +1 for stealth/intel failures.

companions_silver_hand_intel.notes: Parallel side-plot B. Can be run concurrently with schism arc. Feeds into companions_silver_hand_strike_gallows_rock.

companions_silver_hand_strike_gallows_ro.name: Silver Hand: Gallows Rock
companions_silver_hand_strike_gallows_ro.description: The Companions strike hard at Gallows Rock, the Silver Hand's primary stronghold. This is the canon tie point for 'The Silver Hand' quest. Skjor leads the assault. The battle is brutal and the outcome shapes the Silver Hand's capacity to assault Jorrvaskr.
objectives: Travel to Gallows Rock with Skjor and available Circle members
Fight through Silver Hand defenses to the central hall
Eliminate the Silver Hand commander (or drive them out)
Rescue any captured Companions if present
rewards: silver_hand_assault_preparation clock reduced by 2
Silver Hand faction standing -20 (permanent)
Gallows Rock cleared: safe house option for future travel
Skjor trust +10 regardless of schism resolution

outcomes.skjor_survives: Skjor emerges bloodied but standing. His survival here affects the assault's defense pool.
outcomes.skjor_falls: Skjor is killed at Gallows Rock. Sets skjor_dead=true. Aela's grief ticks the schism clock +1 if reform path chosen. Silver hand assault prep clock ticks +1 (emboldened by the kill).
outcomes.commander_escapes: The Silver Hand commander escapes. silver_hand_assault_preparation clock ticks +1.

companions_silver_hand_strike_gallows_ro.notes: Canon tie to 'The Silver Hand' quest. Skjor's survival here is NOT guaranteed — the GM should not protect him by default. His death is a legitimate campaign outcome with downstream consequences.

companions_silver_hand_endgame.name: Silver Hand: Endgame
companions_silver_hand_endgame.description: The remaining Silver Hand cells must be wiped out or driven from Skyrim before they can launch their assault on Jorrvaskr. This mirrors the canon 'Purity of Revenge' beat. Success here dramatically reduces assault preparation; failure locks the assault as inevitable.
objectives: Hunt down remaining Silver Hand cells (at least two locations)
Eliminate or scatter the Silver Hand leadership remnants
Recover stolen Companions artifacts if any were taken
Report to Aela — the threat is contained or the clock has run out
rewards: silver_hand_assault_preparation clock reduced to 0 if all cells cleared (assault avoided entirely — Jorrvaskr escapes the major assault)
If clock > 0 after endgame: assault triggers at companions_jorvaskr_assault
Aela trust +15
companions_silver_hand_endgame.notes: If the assault clock reaches 6 before this quest completes, the assault fires regardless. Completing this quest successfully can skip companions_jorvaskr_assault entirely — a meaningful success reward.

companions_jorvaskr_assault.name: The Assault on Jorrvaskr
companions_jorvaskr_assault.description: The Silver Hand attacks Jorrvaskr in force. This is a staged set-piece event with real lethal risk for named NPCs. The defense pool (Jorrvaskr Defense Pool clock) tracks how many defenders survive. Kodlak and Skjor are at risk. The assault plays out in three acts.
objectives: Act 1: Hold the outer yard — repel the first Silver Hand wave
Act 2: Protect the Grand Hall — prevent breach of the inner sanctum
Act 3: Confront the Silver Hand commander in the Harbinger's chamber
companions_jorvaskr_assault.trigger_condition: silver_hand_assault_preparation clock reaches 6 OR companions_silver_hand_endgame fails

defense_pool.description: The Jorrvaskr Defense Pool is a group consequence track. Each named NPC can absorb one consequence before being taken out. Taken-out NPCs are dead or expelled.
save_gates: PC Physique vs Great (+4) to pull Kodlak from a killing blow
PC Fight vs Superb (+5) to hold the breach in Act 2
PC Will vs Good (+3) to prevent panic among the whelps

outcomes.hall_holds_kodlak_lives: The assault is repelled. Kodlak lives but is wounded. Hall is damaged. Schism is partially healed by shared crisis.
outcomes.hall_holds_kodlak_falls: The assault is repelled but Kodlak is killed in the fighting. Sets kodlak_dead_assault=true. The purity path's moral weight becomes Kodlak's legacy.
outcomes.hall_holds_skjor_falls: Skjor is killed defending the breach. Sets skjor_dead_assault=true. Aela's grief is immediate and consuming.
outcomes.both_veterans_fall: Kodlak and Skjor both die in the assault. The Companions are shattered. Sets hall_shattered_state=true.

companions_jorvaskr_assault.notes: Skip this quest entirely if companions_silver_hand_endgame cleared all cells (silver_hand_assault_preparation == 0). The internal_civil_war flag (from schism breakpoint) reduces the defense pool by 2 defenders.

companions_funeral_rites.name: Funeral Rites
companions_funeral_rites.description: The journey to Ysgramor's Tomb to lay the veterans to rest. One or both of Kodlak and Skjor may be dead. In the tomb's depths, a final twist awaits — and the PC must choose the Companions' final state: Restructured Order, Hall Shatters, or Old Ways Reforged.
objectives: Gather surviving Companions and travel to Ysgramor's Tomb
Fight through the tomb and lay the dead to rest at Ysgramor's statue
Face the tomb's final twist (content determined by death flags)
Choose the final state of the Companions

restructure.description: New doctrine, new oaths, new leadership structure. The Companions are reborn.

destruction.description: The hall shatters. Survivors disperse. Jorrvaskr stands empty. The Companions are legend again.

reforged_tradition.description: The Old Ways survive, tempered by the cost of the assault. Limited reforms adopted. Wuuthrad reforged.

rewards: Harbinger title (PC becomes leader of surviving Companions)
Wuuthrad (Reforged) — if not already held
+3 Companions faction standing (maximum)
Breath of Ysgramor stunt if Kodlak's spirit appears (requires kodlak_cured or kodlak_died_with_honor)
companions_funeral_rites.notes: Replaces companions_final_journey as the arc's true finale. The 'twist' in the tomb should be keyed to the PC's choice history — the ghost of whoever died most meaningfully can appear. Ysgramor's Tomb layout uses the existing data/locations/ entries.

companions_final_journey.name: Dragon at the Barrow
companions_final_journey.description: The Companions march on Ysgramor's Tomb to lay Kodlak to rest with honor and put a dragon that has nested in the burial mound to the sword. There, in sight of Ysgramor's statue, the PC completes the arc - and if the cure was completed, Kodlak's spirit briefly appears to grant the Breath of Ysgramor power.
objectives: Gather the Companions and travel to Ysgramor's Tomb
Fight through the tomb's draugr and the nesting dragon
Lay Kodlak's ashes or spirit to rest at Ysgramor's statue
Receive the Breath of Ysgramor advancement if eligible
rewards: Harbinger title (PC becomes leader of the Companions)
Breath of Ysgramor advancement (see data/stunts/companions.json)
+3 Companions faction standing (maximum)
Jorrvaskr as a permanent safe house and resource

outcomes.dragon_slain_with_honor: The dragon falls and the Companions cheer. Ysgramor's statue seems to glow warmly. Breath of Ysgramor is unlocked.
outcomes.kodlak_spirit_farewell: If cured, Kodlak's shade appears briefly. His final words create a permanent scene aspect 'Harbinger's Blessing' with 1 free invoke.
outcomes.beast_burial: If not cured, Farkas howls at the barrow entrance. The Companions honor the warrior, not the soul's fate.

companions_final_journey.notes: Final quest in the Companions arc. After this quest, companions_state.active_quest is set to null. The Harbinger title gives the PC narrative authority over Jorrvaskr NPCs. Breath of Ysgramor stunt is found in data/stunts/companions.json.
